arm5e.system.dependencyWarning: The system requires module {name} to be at least version {minimum}, the current version is {current}. You may encounter errors and bugs, please update
arm5e.sheet.wound.label: Wound
arm5e.sheet.combatInstructions1: Equip weapons and armor to see the totals.
arm5e.sheet.combatInstructions2: If your specialty is with the shield, mark it on the shield and not on the weapon. If you don't have the shield equipped, the specialty bonus doesn't apply.
arm5e.sheet.combatInstructions3: Create a 'mounted' item with the ability to 'mount' and mark on its attributes that it is a horse. When you equip it, the calculations will be applied.

arm5e.sheet.setAbilities: Create abilities for your character that match the labels below. This ensures correct calculations. If you don't have the ability, you can still create it and set to zero and assign it.

arm5e.sheet.buildingsSumary: 1 pound per 10 pts Inhabitants (50% per craft)
arm5e.sheet.consumablesSumary: 2 pounds per 10 pts Inhabitants (20% per craft)
arm5e.sheet.laboratoriesSumary: 1 pound per 10 pts Laboratories (20% per craft)
arm5e.sheet.provisionsSumary: 5 pounds per 10 pts Inhabitants (50% + 20% per craft)
arm5e.sheet.weaponsSumary: 1 pound per 320 points Weapons and Armor (50% per craft)
arm5e.sheet.writingMaterialsSumary: 1 pound per Magus and book specialist (50% per craft)
arm5e.sheet.visDesc: Vis extracted from "{covenant}" covenant's vis' source named "{name}".

arm5e.sheet.realm.visibleHint: Show or hide the aura modifier when rolling
arm5e.sheet.authorship.author: Author

arm5e.spell.targets.baseSize.label: Base size
arm5e.spell.targets.baseSize.an: An animal of about the same size as a pony, Size +1 or lower.
arm5e.spell.targets.baseSize.aq: A pool of water about five paces (fifteen feet) across, and two paces deep at the center. Naturally-occurring liquids, such as fruit juice or olive oil, have a base Individual one-tenth the size, about two paces across and about one deep. Processed liquids, such as wine or beer, have a base Individual one hundredth the size, a pool about one pace across and half a pace deep. Corrosive and otherwise dangerous liquids have a base Individual ten times smaller again, a puddle about half a pace across and about a fifth of a pace deep. Poisons have a base Individual of a single dose.
arm5e.spell.targets.baseSize.au: A weather phenomenon that affects the area within a standard Boundary — an area one hundred paces across.
arm5e.spell.targets.baseSize.co: An adult human being, up to Size +1
arm5e.spell.targets.baseSize.he: Plant roughly one pace in each direction
arm5e.spell.targets.baseSize.ig: A large campfire or the fire in the hearth of a great hall
arm5e.spell.targets.baseSize.im: The equivalent of an adult human being; whether a visual image of about that size, an auditory illusion making that much noise, or whatever.
arm5e.spell.targets.baseSize.me: A mind is a mind, no size
arm5e.spell.targets.baseSize.te: Depend on material: For sand, dirt, mud, clay, or similar substances, it is about ten cubic paces of stuff. For stone, it is a single cubic pace. For base metals, it is a cubic foot, while for precious metals it is a tenth of that. For gemstones, the base individual is one cubic inch in size.
arm5e.spell.targets.baseSize.vi: A spell or depend on the effect

arm5e.notification.unconscious: This character is unconscious, no action possible...
arm5e.notification.incapacited: This character is gravely wounded, no action possible...
arm5e.notification.pendingCrisis: This character has a pending aging crisis, no action possible... Resolve the crisis by clicking the skull next to the character name
arm5e.notification.pendingTwilight: This character has a pending Twilight episode, no roll possible until resolved. (Shift click as a GM to remove this status)
arm5e.notification.codex.none: You don't have a Actor of type 'magicCodex' in your world, some functionality will be disabled/not working, you can import the one in the Magi compendium
arm5e.notification.codex.tooMany: You have more than one Actor of type 'magicCodex in your world, some functionality is based on the uniqueness of magicCodex, you may want to delete one (after merging if needed)
arm5e.notification.codex.enchant: You need a Codex actor with enchantments to enchant this way.
arm5e.notification.crucible.no.invest.po: Item's size and material are not good enough for this level of enchantment.
arm5e.notification.notPossibleToCalculat: We cannot calculate the wound (check the size of your actor)
arm5e.notification.roll.botchNum: Please enter the number of botch dice.
arm5e.notification.doubleAbility: That character already have the ability
arm5e.notification.noMightPoints: Not enough points remaining in might pool.
arm5e.notification.noChargesLeft: No charges left in the magic item.
arm5e.notification.setDate: The current date has been set to {season} {year}
arm5e.notification.synchActors: All actors have been synchronized to {season} {year}
arm5e.notification.missingSpell: Spell "{spellName}" doesn't exist anymore or has moved. Aborting.
arm5e.notification.notMagus: This character is not a magus/maga.
arm5e.notification.noLab: This character doesn't own a lab.
arm5e.notification.noOwner: This laboratory doesn't have an owner.
arm5e.notification.noEnoughVis: {name} doesn't have enough pawns of vis to perform this action.
arm5e.notification.situationHasChanged: The situation has changed, applying is no longer possible.
arm5e.notification.effectLinked: Deletion impossible. An effect is linked to that capacity.
arm5e.notification.itemMoved: The item named "{name}" has moved and can longer be found.
arm5e.notification.entityWithMultipleRea: This character with Might is aligned with multiple realms. Check the active effects.

arm5e.messages.die.noBotch: No botch out of {dicenum} dice rolled!

arm5e.aging.roll.label: Aging roll
arm5e.aging.roll.normal: Apparent age increases by one year.
arm5e.aging.roll.crisis: Gain sufficient Aging Points (in any Characteristics) to reach the next level in Decrepitude, and Crisis.
arm5e.aging.roll.StrStaPts: 1 Aging Point in Str and Sta.
arm5e.aging.roll.DexQikPts: 1 Aging Point in Dex and Qik.
arm5e.aging.roll.ComPrsPts: 1 Aging Point in Com and Prs.
arm5e.aging.roll.IntPerPts: 1 Aging Point in Int and Per.
arm5e.aging.crisis.label: Aging crisis
arm5e.aging.crisis.minorIllness: Minor illness. Stamina roll of 3+ or CrCo20 to survive.
arm5e.aging.crisis.seriousIllness: Serious illness. Stamina roll of 6+ or CrCo25 to survive.
arm5e.aging.crisis.majorIllness: Major illness. Stamina roll of 9+ or CrCo30 to survive.
arm5e.aging.crisis.criticalIllness: Critical illness. Stamina roll of 12+ or CrCo35 to survive.
arm5e.aging.result0: As sand through the hourglass, so pass the seasons of life...
arm5e.aging.result3: It resulted in a health crisis.
arm5e.aging.result7: - Gained {num} point(s) of Warping due to longevity potion.
arm5e.aging.rollback.title: Revert effect of aging roll
arm5e.aging.rollback.confirm: This action will revert the effect of aging and delete the diary entry. Are you sure?
arm5e.aging.manualEdit: {name} lost one point in {char} due to aging.

arm5e.activity.msg.wrongSingleItemXp: No more than {param} XP can be assigned to a single ability, spell or art.
arm5e.activity.msg.wrongTotalXp: Total experience ({param}) must be equal to source.
arm5e.activity.msg.missingMotherTongue: Childhood must include a living language at level 5 (75 xps).
arm5e.activity.msg.wrongOption: The option chosen ({param}) is not valid with current progress items.
arm5e.activity.msg.uselessTeacher: {param} has nothing to teach to this character.
arm5e.activity.msg.tooManyItems: Too many progress items, maximum is {param}.
arm5e.activity.msg.gainCapped: The experience gain has been capped to {param}, the student will equal the master.
arm5e.activity.msg.activityEndsInFuture: Impossible to apply. This activity ends in the future
arm5e.activity.msg.agingInWinter: Aging happens usually in winter unless it is an external effect.
arm5e.activity.msg.unappliedActivities: There are still unapplied activities scheduled before this one.

arm5e.scriptorium.msg.unconfirmedLang: Please confirm that the scribe speaks all languages listed.
arm5e.scriptorium.msg.readerIsAuthor: The reader seems to be the author of the book!
arm5e.scriptorium.msg.tooManyTractati: The writer has already writen too many Tractati on the topic.
arm5e.scriptorium.msg.tractatusAlreadyRe: The reader has already read a very similar Tractatus on the same topic and of the same quality in "{title}"
arm5e.scriptorium.msg.cappedQuality: This book has become an easy read. The quality is reduced to {item}

arm5e.scriptorium.msg.diaryDescCopying: {name} copied some topics in the following books:

arm5e.scriptorium.msg.notMagus: The reader is not a magus.
arm5e.scriptorium.msg.labText: Laboratory texts are studied in a lab.
arm5e.scriptorium.msg.missingSupernatura: Supernatural abilities cannot be learned from scratch with a book.
arm5e.scriptorium.msg.topicNoFound: Impossible to find the book or the topic which was writen.
arm5e.scriptorium.msg.translationOnly: Only possible to translate the writer's own draft laboratory texts.
arm5e.scriptorium.msg.tooManyLTLevels: Too many levels of laboratory texts
arm5e.scriptorium.msg.noSimilarTopic: No topic of similar type in that book
arm5e.scriptorium.msg.unfamiliarTopic: Unfamiliar topic ({topic}), any copy may be corrupted and useless (Confirm with storyguide).
arm5e.scriptorium.msg.unfamiliarTopic2: Confirm with the Storyguide that the scribe is skilled enough in a related ability.
arm5e.sanatorium.daysLeft: {days} days left on next recovery roll
arm5e.sanatorium.msg.logDone: Nothing else can be done this season.
arm5e.book.summaLong: Summa of level {level} and quality {quality} about
arm5e.config.hint.compendiaRef: Select the module that will serve as reference to the system for compendium content
arm5e.rolltables.experimentation.disaste: You avoid disaster but waste the season.
Your creation is destroyed, and so is some other valuable item that you keep in your laboratory.

Explosion! Your lab equipment is ruined, and you must roll a simple die for each valuble possession you keep in your lab. On a 0, it is destroyed. You take an amount of damage equal to a simple die + the level of the spell or effect you were working on.
Your experiment backfires in such a way that the entire convenant is threatened, either through fire, the summoning of a major threat, or some other calamity the storyguide makes up.
You gain Warping Points equal to the number of zeroes on the botch roll. Roll for Twilight if you gain two or more
Roll twice more on this chart.
arm5e.rolltables.experimentation.discove: You gain 15 experience points in Magic Theory
You gain 15 experience points in some Ability related to the experiment.
You gain three experience points in one of the Arts used in the experiment
You gain enough experience points to bring one of the Arts used in the experiment to the next level (or three experience points, whichever is greater).
Roll twice, and reroll this result if it is generated again
arm5e.twilight.reset: Do you want to reset this Twilight Episode?
arm5e.twilight.control.question: Do you want to resist Twilight?
arm5e.twilight.embraceTwilight: Do you want to embrace twilight or try to avoid it?
arm5e.twilight.tooltips.pendingUnderstan: Pending Twilight understanding's roll via diary entry
arm5e.twilight.diary.botchedControl: {name} failed miserably to control the surge of magic (strength {str}) and was left with a big headache and some memory loss.
arm5e.twilight.diary.failedControl: {name} failed to control the surge of magic (strength {str}) and went into Twilight
arm5e.twilight.diary.successControl: {name} successfully controled the surge of magic (strength {str}) and avoided Twilight
arm5e.twilight.diary.embraced: {name} embraced the surge of magic and went into Twilight
